channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Giuliani and Other Trump Allies Arraigned in Arizona Election Case
item.description: A total of 50 people, including former President Donald J. Trump, are now facing charges in four states related to efforts to keep Mr. Trump in power after he lost in 2020.

item.title: In Germany, Far-Right Plotters of an Improbable Coup Go on Trial
item.description: Members of a group called the “United Patriots” are accused of planning to bring a prince into power by violently overthrowing the government.

item.title: The starting salary for a new American Airlines flight attendant is low enough to qualify for food stamps in some states
item.description: Legislation prevents workers from striking without permission from the government.

item.title: Elvis Presley’s Granddaughter, Riley Keough, Sues to Block Graceland Sale
item.description: His granddaughter, the actress Riley Keough, claims that a company is fraudulently planning to auction off Elvis’s home in Memphis.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: For Gazans Relocating Once Again, Conditions Are ‘Horrific’
item.description: People leaving the city of Rafah since Israel’s military started to move in are crowding into other parts of Gaza, where they lack the most basic hygiene and infrastructure, a U.N. official said.

item.title: Cyberattacks are soaring—and more lucrative for criminals than drugs. It's time to treat them as an 'act of war', health care exec warns
item.description: Cybercrime profits now surpass "all of the illegal drug trafficking in the world combined," Verily CEO Stephen Gillett said at Fortune's Brainstorm Health conference.

item.title: Kerry Kennedy Leads ‘Heart-Wrenching’ Campaign Against Her Brother’s White House Bid
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s sister has become the face of the Kennedy family effort to block his candidacy and re-elect President Biden. She has more at stake besides her relationship with her brother.

item.title: Top Oceans Court Says Nations Must Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
item.description: Experts say the opinion, though nonbinding, is likely to lead to more claims for damages against polluting nations.

item.title: Jamie Dimon shocks Wall Street, hinting at his retirement in the next five years and reciting a laundry list of red flags about the global economy
item.description: Dimon says he’s “cautiously pessimistic” about the future of inflation, spending, and the geopolitical landscape.

item.title: Scarlett Johansson Said No, but OpenAI’s Virtual Assistant Sounds Just Like Her
item.description: Last week, the company released a chatbot with an option that sounded like the actress, who provided the voice of an A.I. system in the movie “Her.”

item.title: One Dead After ‘Extreme Turbulence’ on Singapore Airlines Flight
item.description: A Singapore Airlines flight from London was diverted to Bangkok, where more than 70 people were being treated for injuries.

item.title: Tech companies are voluntarily agreeing to an AI ‘kill switch’ to prevent Terminator-style risks as some regulators remain hesitant to flex their legal muscles
item.description: Developers and governments reach consensus, but “toothless” commitments fall short of formal global legal frameworks.

item.title: Top Oceans Court Says Nations Must Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
item.description: Experts say the opinion, though nonbinding, is likely to lead to more claims for damages against polluting nations.

item.title: Iran Begins Funeral Events for President Raisi After Helicopter Crash
item.description: A procession in the city of Tabriz was the first in a string of events after Ebrahim Raisi’s death in a helicopter crash. Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has announced five days of mourning.

item.title: Health care workforce challenges must be addressed to support Black mothers
item.description: In order to serve Black mothers, the healthcare workforce must properly focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion.
